occurrences.text: 17, is that not what happens? You can't do this. You're here. You're here. I know the pride of your heart. The reality is that David, he's going to stand before God, and so are you. Before Saul and Eliab and all the others should be casting judgment at David, they should be examining their own hearts. And we find here, he says it's to God. The rewards that will be received, their crowns I mentioned earlier, 2 John 8 says that we may receive a full reward. The motivation in and of itself is not that we'd receive a crown or a reward, but we understand the truth of God's Word that there are rewards, crowns to be received. He tells it to us in the New Testament. There are many examples. Paul had confidence when he writes in 2 Timothy 4 about the day of his departure being at hand, and he says, henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness. He knew. He had confidence. Why? Because he said that the righteous judge would give it to him, but not to me also, but also to all of them who love his appearing. What's going to happen with those crowns? I alluded to it a few minutes ago, but look at Revelation 4 this morning. Revelation chapter number 4.
